text: Vernon, also known as the Anna Maria Ward House, was a historic plantation house located near Mount Olive, Wayne County, North Carolina. It was built about 1837, and was a two-story, five bay by two bay, Federal style frame dwelling. It sat on a brick pier foundation and one-story shed porch that replaced a mid-19th century two-story porch of Italianate design. It has been demolished. It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1974. ==References== Category:Plantation houses in North Carolina Category:Houses on the National Register of Historic Places in North Carolina Category:Federal architecture in North Carolina Category:Houses completed in 1837 Category:Houses in Wayne County, North Carolina Category:National Register of Historic Places in Wayne County, North Carolina
title: Vernon (Mount Olive, North Carolina)
